greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array read by rows.  T(n,k) is the number of sets of exactly k distinct binary words with a total of n letters.
comment: Equivalently, T(n,k) is the number of integer partitions of n into distinct parts with two types of 1's, four types of 2's, ... , 2^i types of i's,...; where k is the number of summands (of any type).
Row lengths increase by 1 at n=A061168(offset).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..300, flattened
P. Flajolet and R. Sedgewick, Analytic Combinatorics, 2009; see page 64
example: T(3,2) = 8 because we have: {a,aa}, {a,ab}, {a,ba}, {a,bb}, {b,aa}, {b,ab}, {b,ba}, {b,bb}; 2 word languages with total length 3.
maple: h:= proc(n, i) option remember; expand(`if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=1..degree(p)))(h(n$2)):
mathematica: nn=12; p=Product[(1+y x^i)^(2^i), {i,1,nn}]; f[list_] := Select[list, #>0&]; Map[f, Drop[CoefficientList[Series[p[x,y], {x,0,nn}], {x,y}], 1]]//Flatten
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Mar 08 2012
